greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the sum over the inverse products of adjacent odd primes.
comment: Contains the contribution from twin primes (A209328) plus other contributions from cousin primes (A143206) not already part of twin primes, sexy primes (A210477) not already accounted for, etc.
Summing up to (and including) 12-digit primes yields 0.134426509691698261. - _Hans Havermann_, Mar 17 2013
link: R. J. Mathar, Estimate of the Sum over Inverse Products of Adjacent Prime Pairs
formula: Extrapolation of this data (using Aitken's method) indeed suggests a value of 0.134426509692, rounded to the last decimal place. Extrapolation of the ratios of the first differences (9.02e-6, 7.35e-7, 6.19e-8, 5.34e-9, 4.699e-10) yields subsequent terms (4.26e-11, 4.0e-12). - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 22 2013
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 19 2013
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 08 2013
